system.base.Wet_paginator

type
class

Constructor

new(baseURL : String, number_of_results : Int, results_per_page : Int)
parameters
this.base_url required parameter, baseURL of the controller/method including the website base.
number_of_results The total number of records in available for display - the count from your SQL query, typically
results_per_page The number of results you're going to ouput in a single page.
throws
a general error if results per page is silly ( i.e. <= 0)
see
* USAGE: var pg = new Wet_paginator("http://localhost:2000/?front/demo/", 200, 5);
pg.generate_links({separator : " ", sideband_width : 6});
trace(pg.get_current_links());

Instance Methods

generate_links(config : Dynamic) : String

parameters
this.base_url A required parameter, baseURL of the controller/method including the website base.
url_segment the segment number carrying the current page number - this is defaults to seg. 3 which assumes a path of uri://controller/method/page
full_tag_open HTML inserted BEFORE the entire paginator string is output - typically a DIV section.
full_tag_close HTML inserted AFTER the entire paginator string is output - typically a closing DIV.
first_tag_open HTML before the FIRST PAGE link.
first_link HTML character or phrase denoting the FIRST page link. Defaults to "<<". Use of entities such as &rsaquo is discouraged,
first_link_id unique DIV ID of the first link for scripting the link
first_tag_close HTML after the FIRST PAGE link.
last_tag_open HTML before the LAST PAGE link.
last_link HTML character or phrase denoting the LAST page link. Defaults to ">>".
last_tag_close HTML after the LAST PAGE link.
last_link_id unique DIV ID of the last link for scripting the link
next_link HTML or character denoting move UP one page. Defaults to ">"
next_link_id see first_link_id
next_tag_open see first_tag_open
next_tag_close see first_tag_close
prev_link see first_link
prev_link_id see first_link_id
prev_tag_open see first_tag_open
prev_tag_close see first_tag_close
number_class style definition applied to every page number except the current page
link_class style definition applied to every non-numeric link
nolink_class style definition applied to the current page
elipses Used when there are more pages available than can be displayed (can appear either or both sides). Defaults to "..."
separator separates the numbers when used. Defaults to "-"
sideband_width the number of pages on either side of the CURRENT page (where available.) If more pages are available, a ELIPSES is displayed.
hints Include hints in the links such as Page X of Y
returns
A formatted string ready to insert into your HTML
see
option names are provided for broad compatibility with Codeigniter 1.6+ with extentions unique to Webrathea
config is an anonymous dynamic object formatted (for example):
{link_class : "link special", nolink_class : "greyed"}

get_current_links() : String

returns
A string containing the last set of links generated. This function can be used multiple times for speed, but custom options should be sepecified by generate_links FIRST
